articles.description: Protesters with red-painted hands shouted "ceasefire now!", interrupting the US Secretary of State.

articles.description: Natalie Raanan and her mother Judith were visiting family in Israel when they were taken hostage on 7 October.
articles.title: Natalie Raanan, a teen taken hostage by Hamas, is home in Chicago

articles.description: The cast of Friends say they are grieving the "unfathomable loss" of their fellow star on Saturday.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Before an outburst of violence, Telegram channels spread hate speech. The BBC has tracked messages inciting the public to gather at an airport where a flight from Tel Aviv was arriving.
articles.title: How social media fuelled antisemitic violence in Dagestan, Russia

articles.description: At a formal ceremony, the future queen promises to uphold the constitution.
articles.title: Watch: Spain's Princess Leonor turns 18 and swears oath

articles.description: Hosting a men's World Cup has long been an ambition for Saudi Arabia writes BBC sports editor Dan Roan, but questions and intense scrutiny will remain.
articles.title: Why Saudi 2034 World Cup should not surprise anyone

articles.description: Some 60 Stars of David were daubed on buildings in the 14th arrondissement of Paris.
articles.title: Antisemitic graffiti in Paris worries French leaders

articles.description: Alarm was sounded about Robert Card three months before he shot and killed 18 people in Lewiston.
articles.title: US Army warned Maine suspect too 'erratic' to have gun

articles.description: The judge criticised what he referred to as 'astonishing failures' of Whakaari Management.
articles.title: White Island: Company found guilty over NZ volcano disaster
